title: Fluffy Pancakes
description: Light and fluffy pancakes perfect for breakfast
steps: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.
Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg and melted butter; mix until smooth.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake.
Brown on both sides and serve hot with maple syrup and butter.

title: Homemade Pizza
description: Classic homemade pizza with a crispy crust
steps: In a large bowl, mix flour, salt, sugar, and yeast.
Add water and oil, then mix until a soft dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 5 minutes.
Let the dough rise in a warm place for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C).
Roll out the dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
Transfer to a pizza pan or baking sheet.
Spread tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a small border.
Sprinkle with cheese and add your favorite toppings.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Classic chocolate chip cookies that are soft and chewy
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cream together the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla.
Dissolve baking soda in hot water. Add to batter along with salt.
Stir in flour and chocolate chips.
Drop by large spoonfuls onto ungreased pans.
Bake for about 10 minutes or until edges are nicely browned.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
description: Quick and healthy vegetable stir fry with a savory sauce
ingredients: 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
steps: Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add onions and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add bell peppers, carrots, broccoli, and snap peas. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, and sesame oil.
Pour sauce over vegetables and toss to coat.
Add cornstarch mixture and stir until sauce thickens.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

title: Creamy Garlic Parmesan Pasta
description: Rich and creamy pasta with garlic and parmesan cheese
steps: Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water before draining.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant (don't let it brown).
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low and gradually whisk in Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth.
Season with salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes if using.
Add drained pasta to the sauce and toss to coat. If sauce is too thick, add reserved pasta water a little at a time.
Garnish with fresh parsley and additional Parmesan cheese.
Serve immediately while hot and creamy.

title: Hearty Vegetable Soup
description: Comforting and nutritious vegetable soup perfect for cold days
ingredients: 1 cup green beans, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 cup small pasta (like ditalini or small shells)
1 can (15 oz) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion, carrots, and celery. Cook for 5 minutes until vegetables begin to soften.
Add garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add zucchini and green beans, cook for 2 minutes.
Stir in diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, thyme, oregano, and bay leaf.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add pasta and kidney beans, cook until pasta is tender (about 8-10 minutes).
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted, about 1 minute.
Remove bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese if desired.

title: Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken
description: Juicy grilled chicken with bright lemon and herb flavors
steps: In a bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, rosemary, thyme, parsley, lemon zest, salt, and pepper.
Place chicken breasts in a large resealable bag and pour marinade over them.
Seal the bag and massage to coat chicken evenly. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes (or up to 4 hours).
Preheat grill to medium-high heat (about 375-400°F).
Remove chicken from marinade and discard the remaining marinade.
Grill chicken for 5-7 minutes per side, or until internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes before serving.
Garnish with fresh herbs and lemon slices.
Serve with your favorite sides like roasted vegetables or rice.

title: Classic Cheesecake
description: Smooth and creamy classic cheesecake with a graham cracker crust
steps: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Grease a 9-inch springform pan.
For the crust: In a medium bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter. Press mixture into the bottom of the prepared pan.
Bake crust for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside to cool.
For the filling: In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth.
Gradually add sugar and beat until creamy.
Add sour cream and vanilla, beat until well combined.
Add eggs one at a time, beating just until blended after each addition. Do not overmix.
Pour filling over the crust and smooth the top.
Bake for 55-60 minutes, or until center is almost set (it should still jiggle slightly).
Turn off the oven, crack the door open, and let cheesecake cool in oven for 1 hour.
Remove from oven and run a knife around the edge of the pan to loosen.
Cool completely, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Optional: Before serving, mix topping ingredients and spread over cheesecake.
Garnish with fresh berries and serve chilled.

title: Sausage Ragu
description: A hearty Italian pasta sauce made with sausage, tomatoes, and herbs
ingredients: Pasta of your choice for serving
steps: Heat a large pan over medium heat
Add the sausage and break it up with a wooden spoon while it cooks
Once browned, remove excess fat if needed
Add onion, garlic, and carrot, cooking until vegetables are soft
Pour in the red wine and let it simmer for 2 minutes
Add crushed tomatoes, oregano, and bay leaf
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Remove bay leaf before serving
Serve over cooked pasta with grated Parmesan cheese on top
